definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The night watchmen who apprehended the thief was praised for his vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 捉住小偷的守夜人因其警惕性而受到人们的赞扬。

sentences.english: We must not let down our vigilance against the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 我们决不可放松对敌人的警惕性。

sentences.english: The price of liberty is eternal vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 警惕性是万万不可放松的。

sentences.english: Research has shown that the lavender scent increases alertness.
sentences.chinese: 研究表明薰衣草香味会提高人的警惕性。

sentences.english: The demiwolf is very alert - nothing can escape its eyes.
sentences.chinese: 狼狗的警惕性很高，任何风吹草动都躲不过它的眼睛。

sentences.english: Here are ten techniques for keeping up a day-to-day financial vigilance.
sentences.chinese: 这里有10个技巧来保持日复一日的理财警惕性。
我们的警惕性从来没有放松过。

definition: to be on the alert/vigilant/alert/on guard/to warn
to neglect to take precautions/relaxed vigilance
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
eyesight/strength of vision/the ability to make discerning judgments
